comment.author: 25227946@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/28047774@N04] It's not a negative. It's a direct positive (read up on wet plate collodion), which means the picture will be mirrored.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: There were some cameras that could reverse the image from the lens with mirrors or prisms (or sometimes the photographer shot a copy of the original), but most of the Civil War ambrotypes and tintypes shown by LOC are reverse images. (Check out the reversed belt buckle logo on the next photo in the series).
